snippet: In hashing out one of the hardest-to-negotiate arms control agreements in history, Iran and the United States took a simple approach: stay in the same hotel room until they figure out how to get along.
abstract: Framework for Iran nuclear deal is built on significant compromises from both sides that allows 1,000 centrifuges to remain at Iran's Fordo facility as long as they have no fissile material; timing of sanctions relief remains unresolved, and compromises must survive final negotiating round and review in Washington and Tehran for approval.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Peter Baker contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: In hashing out one of the hardest-to-negotiate arms control agreements in history, Iran and the United States took a simple approach: stay in the same hotel room until they figure out how to get along.

headline.main: An Iran Nuclear Deal Built on Coffee, All-Nighters and Compromise
